reviewText:
Saw this when I was a kid on VHS. Taught me a lesson I still use to this day. " If you can't beat them, avoid them. " That does not mean run away. It means, don't go at them head on. Use your head. Anyways.
Prince's, magic sword, crazy monks, what more do you want.
Some of the best choreographed fight scenes ever and it's wonderfully funny, too. Just sit back and enjoy every minute.
Not much to say here because this film depicts the golden age of the genre with Shaw Brothers' typical all star cast ( if you know the characters ). Thanks for the memories... I know, how cliche!
four star
Lots of action.
Must see TV!!!  10 chops!
GOOD MOVIE !
The action sequences were good as well as the acting.  Shaw Brothers never disappoints its audience for these are classic martial arts movies.
It's a good Kung fu flick. Not my favorite but it is entertaining.
sappy and mindless entertainment
great movie
It's a good combination of Martial Arts, and comedy.
Dubbed and felt corny. couldn't finish the first episode, which was disappointing as we like these kinds of flicks.
It was a good film, but the sound quality was not that great
Memories of my childhood!
Fantastic!
Love these old school movies
good
Good news is it's in English, but it doesn't make any difference because you'll turn it off in 10 minutes
Good combination of action and comedy
ok
Good movie enjoyed it
What a stinker.
Very good action flick.
If U have nothing to do, then watch this movie.  Otherwise, it's not worth it.
Great movie!!
Another fine Shaw Brothers production.  Good bit of intrigue, hella good bit of choreography.
Great movie
it is not even  a good b movie
action and comedy was good.
Really good!
Blast from the past.

One of the best films from the Shaw Brothers' era. The two leading actors are superb and the fight choreography is fantastic.  One of my all time favorite martial arts films from the past.  I take 1 star off for the idiotic English dub.
My husband is a martial arts fanatics. Watched it together. We give it a five stars. Please have more English martial arts movies like this. S.G
Good Movie. Good actions
Very awesome movie
So So comedy.
excellent old school shaolin
Entertaining martial arts movie
Awesome!
Good story line and fighting scenes
Good movie
This movie was very exciting to watch.
nan
Fast paced action, with a hint of three stooges monks. This is a classical martial arts movie, with a well developed plot and script.
would be better if the movie is in the original language.
Enjoyed the story line and fight scenes.
The most ridiculous and most awes inspiring Gung Fu spectacular ever created by mortal man (or WAS it?)

Awful. I actually came back to edit this review. The opening was indeed awful, and I thought I wouldn't be able to watch any more.  But when the fool monks are finally introduced and the training takes off, the movie becomes a hoot.  The star is likeable, and the action immensely enjoyable. And the film uses wire fu--something I don't like at all--in moderation.  Happy to revise this review upwards.  Another great film from Shaw Brothers.
epic.... if you have not watched it, watch it.... great fights, some good laughs, decent story
Shaw Brothers don't disappoint with this story.
One of the great classics! Gravity-fu and the litter grand finale battle!
Lol, this movie is hilarious. Most of the movie is so bad it's actually became funny.
If u enjoy old school Kung fu joints, then u'll like this one! Story is good, fight scenes are great, and from start to finish itll keep u interested to find out what happens!

Kung-Fu movies need to made like these again. These flicks are like Rap Music from The Golden Age of Hip-Hop, and should never have been virtually abandoned by the newer generations. If you Overstand the times these flicks were set in i.e. (weapons, places etc.) You'll love the creativity. One of the Best Martial Arts Films Ever. Shaolin Prince
I liked this movie.  It was cheesy and well done.
A fun old school martial arts entertainment.

Great video quality...I like watching these old kung fu movies and this one didn't disappoint. Kung fu sequences are good -- of course, everything's a little over the top but that's why these are fun to watch.
